During our State of the Open Home livestream, we presented the future of the open home with the announcement of our first roadmap.

title: Patch Tuesday, June 2024 “Recall” Edition
summary: Microsoft today released updates to fix more than 50 security vulnerabilities in Windows and related software, a relatively light Patch Tuesday this month for Windows administrators.  The software giant also responded to a torrent of negative feedback on a new feature of Redmond's flagship operating system that constantly takes screenshots of whatever users are doing on their computers, saying the feature would no longer be enabled by default
